intro: Hisutsua cantoniensis, commonly known as the Guangdong hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
